content: Stream created by Richard Feldman.

welcome, @Chris Wells Wood! :wave:

Chris is a molecular biologist who has offered to be an early alpha user of Roc. He has some use cases that are performance-sensitive but don't require I/O (involving linear algebra, for example), so it's possible for him to give us early feedback even though Roc can't do I/O yet!

Richard Feldman said:

welcome, Chris Wells Wood! :wave:

Chris is a molecular biologist who has offered to be an early alpha user of Roc. He has some use cases that are performance-sensitive but don't require I/O (involving linear algebra, for example), so it's possible for him to give us early feedback even though Roc can't do I/O yet!

Hi everyone! I'm excited to be involved with the project. I'm in the process of porting some of our code across that's currently written in Python and C++. I'll share it once it's in a decent state, and I'd love some feedback for how it could be more efficient or idiomatic.
